result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas A Busshardt

records.addlTxt:
Final status/scheduling conference on January 23, 2023 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial on January 30, 2023 at 08:30 am.

[ma] Cases 22CF121, 21CF356, 21CF576, 21CF617 called at 8:45am 
Defendant Nicholas A Busshardt in court.  Attorney Preston James Smead in court for Nicholas A Busshardt.  Attorney Monica Hall in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Smead indicates that a global offer has been extended, have not made decision regarding offer; suggest status and trial be scheduled.
DA Hall requests trial be scheduled. 

The Court alerts Parties that due to judicial rotation these cases will likely be assigned to Branch 4. 
recess: 8:49am 
NEXT: As to ALL Cases, (1)FSSC on 1/23/23 at 10:00am (2)Jury Trial on 1/30/23 at 8:30am
Status conference on October 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Cases 22CF121, 21CF356, 21CF576, 21CF617 and 21CT331 called at 3:17 PM.  Clerk - CRHI
Prosecuting attorney Jeffrey Martin Shock in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Nicholas A. Busshardt in court.  Attorney Preston James Smead in court for Nicholas A. Busshardt. 
Court reviews case history, status and filings. 
Court establishes that it is the intent of the parties to proceed to disposition in 21CT331 with all other cases continuing as no agreement has been reached in those matters. 
Plea questionnaire and rights form submitted.  Constitutional rights given.  Maximum penalties and elements recited.

COUNT #1 - Guilty  plea entered by the Def. Factual basis stipulated. Victim compliance verified. Court accepts the plea and Finds the Def. guilty and Orders that Judgment of Conviction be entered.

The State moves to read-in and dismiss COUNT #2; so ordered by the Court.

Recommendations presented.
The Court orders:
-  $1,796.00 ($800 fine/costs and DNA surcharge) on a pay plan of $50 per month commencing 9/1/22.  Failure to pay as ordered will result in 30 days jail consecutive with Huber. 
-  $1000 restitution payable to the named victim.  Any bond posted to be applied to restitution first. 
-  Defendant ordered to serve 6 months in the Jefferson County Jail consecutive to any other sentence in being commencing forthwith with Huber privileges extended.  
Def. is required to report for commencement and service of the jail sentence (and the sentence for non payment) with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.  The defendant has credit for 24 days time served. 
-  Drivers license revoked for 24 months. 
-  Ignition Interlock Device required an any vehicle driven by the Def. during the revocation period.
-  AODA  assessment and follow through with recommended treatment.
-  Victim Impact Panel attendance ordered.
-  6 points assessed.

Appeal rights reviewed by the Court. 

22CF121, 21CF356, 21CF576, 21CF617 - future scheduling address by the Court and Counsel.  Cases continued for STC - 10/3/22 at 9am
Recess 3:59pm.

Next - 22CF121, 21CF356, 21CF576, 21CF617 - Notices to be mailed. 
STC - 10/3/22 at 9am
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 28, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

[ma] Cases 22CF121, 21CF356,21CF576,21CF617,21CT331 called at 2:31pm (Court Reporter Michelle Yaklovich appears via zoom)
Defendant Nicholas A Busshardt in court with Attorney Preston James Smead.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Waiver of Preliminary Hearing and Arraignment occur in Case 22CF121:
Mr. Busshardt waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.

Atty Smead requests a plea and sentencing be scheduled in all cases, including 21CT331. 
--ADA Shock joins in request.

The Court removes the Monday trial date, sets over motions should there not be a resolution. 
recess: 2:38pm  

NEXT:  Plea & Sentencing on 7/28/22 at 3:00pm
Waiver of Prelim on May 31, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
ec: DA and Atty Smead (4/22/22--ma)
Proposed Order to Adjourn
Stipulation to Adjourn
Preliminary hearing on April 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
ec: DA and Atty Smead (3/17/22--ma)
Proposed Order Continuance
Continuance Stipulation
Scheduling Order
Preliminary hearing on April 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.  (Notice was also provided to Defendant at JCJ - LZ)

[ma] Cases 21CF356, 21CF576, 21CF617, 21CT331, 22CF121 called at 10:19am 
Defendant Nicholas A. Busshardt in court, in custody with Attorney Preston James Smead.   ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court reviews the court records; cofirms Atty Smead will represent in Case 22CF121.

As to Case 22CF121, Adjourned Initial Apperance occurs: 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.

As to Case 21CF617, Waiver of Preliminary Hearing & Arraignment occur:
Mr. Busshardt waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.

Scheduling is discussed.

Atty Smead requests bond be modified in Case 21CT331; gives argument
--the Court indicates that it will consider a change is bond IF debt to WCS is paid; furthermore SCRAM will be reinstated as a condition of any new/amended bond.
recess: 10:34am 

NEXT:   Preliminary Hearing(22CF121)/Status Conference(all others) on 4/8/22 at 9:00am
Adjourned initial appearance on March 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.

[ma] Case called at 1:16 PM 
Defendant Nicholas A. Busshardt appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Amber Rumpf (PD appears for bond-purposes only--Def intends to hire private counsel).  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.

The Court tolls Preliminary Hearing time limits

The Court requires a $500  Signature Bond
recess 1:19 pm. 

NEXT: Adjourned Initial Appearance on 3/11/22 at 10:00am (address prelim time limits)
Arresting Agency: JESO
